issue.title: world step fails to solve bilateral constraints

content.raw:
Actually, it appears that the double pendulum model works for a while if it has an initial rotation, though it eventually will fail. Apply the following diff to see the result:
~~~
diff -r 24e80279f9a5 test/worlds/world_step.world
--- a/test/worlds/world_step.world	Wed Feb 04 14:58:50 2015 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/world_step.world	Thu Feb 05 17:48:41 2015 -0800
@@ -55,7 +55,8 @@
       </visual>
     </link>
   </model>
- <model name="double_pendulum_with_base">
+  <model name="double_pendulum_with_base">
+    <pose>0 0 0  0 0 1.57</pose>
     <link name="base">
       <inertial>
         <mass>100</mass>
~~~
Maybe there is something numerically problematic about simulating the double pendulum without rotating it?
content.html:
Actually, it appears that the double pendulum model works for a while if it has an initial rotation, though it eventually will fail. Apply the following diff to see the result:

diff -r 24e80279f9a5 test/worlds/world_step.world
--- a/test/worlds/world_step.world  Wed Feb 04 14:58:50 2015 -0800
+++ b/test/worlds/world_step.world  Thu Feb 05 17:48:41 2015 -0800
@@ -55,7 +55,8 @@
       </visual>
     </link>
   </model>
- <model name="double_pendulum_with_base">
+  <model name="double_pendulum_with_base">
+    <pose>0 0 0  0 0 1.57</pose>
     <link name="base">
       <inertial>
         <mass>100</mass>

Maybe there is something numerically problematic about simulating the double pendulum without rotating it?
